Author: gilardh#8348
Content: Hello, when a start my block explorer with ```../bitcore-node start``` command , all is OK . I see the block explorer on 3001 port of my VPS. But if my Terminal windows closes or my PC goes out, my block explorer website stops working. How can I proceed so that the program can run alone on my VPS without help from my PC?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: you can run it in tmux or screen

Author: jorian#4555
Content:
i think screen is friendlier in this situation, so here goes: 
`screen -R explorer` to start a screen session, then in the new session do `../bitcore-node start`

Author: jorian#4555
Content: when it has started, do `CTRL-d` and then press `a`

Author: jorian#4555
Content: you'll go back to where you came from, but the session is still running. to go back to the bitcore output, run `screen -R explorer` again

Author: jorian#4555
Content: @gilardh

Author: gilardh#8348
Content: @jorian Thanks I will test.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gilardh yes, I use `screen` extensively, must have tool

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: on notary nodes, every coin gets their own screen with `screen -S coin`

Content: It's quite easy to backdoor a full node daemon that is open source, and for nobody to see it. This is why closed source full nodes should not even be considered valid in our industry

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I have a question about %PoS/%PoW assetchains. How does the daemon know whether the next block should be mined by PoS or PoW?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: no it can be mined by either

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but if the % is not at target, tehn PoW gets infinatly harder the higher the % goes, so you cant hit a chain with high hash rate. It just wont find anyt blocks.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gilardh p2sh is a type of address, P2SH = pay-to-script-hash, P2PK=pay-to-public-key, P2PKH=pay-to-public-keyhash, there are some others in BTC core now, but I think ZEC forks mostly have those

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gilardh for instance, in each HUSH block, the first output is a P2PK address of the miner, and the second output (vout[1]) is the address of the founders reward in P2PKH format. This might be too much detail, and you can just ignore 😃

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gilardh p2sh in KMD correspond to addresses that start with `b` which are like addresses that start with `t3` in ZEC and old HUSH

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
Hush3 testnet is a misnomer and doesn't really exist (testnets in this ecosystem are just a new chain) and if you pick a name, the addressing for "test" is the same as "main" 
same key = same hash

Author: gilardh#8348
Content: ok, thank you for these clarifications so I could remove the possibility to switch to 'testnet' mode. Now I am trying to find out if other values ​​in mainnet need to be changed.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: testnets are really testchains in KMD world, because we have such great tools to make blockchains

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so what I call a "testnet" is just another asset with a slightly different name `HUSH3T`, the 100% correct term for it would be "testchain" but the industry usually would call this a "testnet"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @gilardh so to clarify, make all the values exactly the same in the `testnet` part of the config

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: all the good test chains have a `CFEK` prefix and run in #kmdlabs
